result.execSummary:
The defendant Reed David Glover was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Reed David Glover is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Reed David Glover was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Reed David Glover

defendant.name: Glover, Reed David
defendant.address: 318 W Walnut Dr, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission
Restitution Information  Supplement to Disposition (Restitution)

Defendant Reed David Glover in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant has paid the restitution in full with the COC office.    Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 1.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed.  Atty Hendee asks that the COC office pay out Restitution.  Atty Gumz agrees.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed.

Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 1:  Court orders 5 months in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; consecutive to any other sentence
  Report on or before June 19, 2017 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
May serve in Door, Kewaunee, Brown or Outagamie County
Credit = 6 days
  DNA Sample + $250.00 Surcharge
Court Costs = $268.00
Restitution = $254.65 + $25.46 surcharge = $280.11
  COC office to pay out Restitution as stated in the supplement
  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.

Ct. 2 to be dismissed.

Atty Hendee and Atty Gumz waives the request for a PSI.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 20, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Final pre-trial on February 3, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial on March 9, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Reed David Glover in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states that the matter is not resolved and asks for a trial to be set.

BY THE COURT:  Set JT.
bond continued.  Jury trial scheduled for March 9, 2017 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 3, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Return date on December 7, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Reed David Glover in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states that his client would like to get the matter resolved and asks for more time to speak to the DA.

BY THE COURT:  Reset
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for December 7, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Return date on October 6, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Reed David Glover in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Gumz; the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today.  Atty Gumz agrees and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information with the Court.  Atty Gumz states that the Defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading.  Atty Gumz enters a Not Guilty plea.

BY THE COURT:  Not Guilty plea entered.
Set for Return.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for October 6, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
State's Discovery Demand
Atty Mark Gumz
Preliminary hearing on September 7, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states that he was recently appointed on the case last week and will be asking for this to be adjourned with the continued waiver of time limits.

BY THE COURT:  Reset.
bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 7, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.

Court questions the defendant regarding the time limits for the Prelim.  Defendant waives the time limits.
BY THE COURT:  Time limits waived; Set for Prelim.

Defendant Reed David Glover in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court confirms defendant's address.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant is on a probation hold at this time;  no objection to a signature bond with conditions.
